Topic.Title: I had a bad day

Message.Msg: You wrote naked calls? ... You know it's earnings season right? Not trying to say anything one way or another, but you got balls.

Topic.Title: I had a bad day

Message.Msg: Options allow you to leverage more earnings to risk ratio. Buying options that expire a year out deep in the money is no more dangerous than owning the stock. At the worst case scenario you could exercise and actually buy the stock for the price your option allows. I usually don't like owning stocks over a year anyway, so it works great for me. I write puts if I want to get the stock cheap or if I believe the company is worth more than the bad news is factoring in. Worst case is that I have to buy the stock. Obviously you could totally get #$%$ if you use options the wrong way like writing naked puts / calls.

Message.Title: What Analyst Don't Understand & Why AMZN will go Way Down
Message.Msg: Most analysts live in gated building in Mahattan with a Doorman. Their delivery is seamless and protected. The other 99% of population has a truck that drives down street and drops package on porch or at front door. Out here on West Coast the crooks merely follow truck and steal packages. It is much easier than shoplifting. There is no security around and no cops to deal with for crooks. Stories are all over the news every night about Amazon package thefts. I stopped buying from Amazon (I used to spend over $1,000 a year @ Amazon). All my neighbors have also stopped. It is much safer to shop in a store. Also on returns it is much easier. In Christmas of 2011, I had to do returns of gifts I gave since people I gave to did not want to mess around returning items by mail or UP or FedX. This Christmas I merely gave them receipt to return to store - I will never buy at Amazon again. Amazon marketing plan is dead. Brick and mortar is now the new future. Get out of AMZN stock while you can. Go to Goole and look at chart of revenues - they dropped from 50% increase to 25% in 9 months! Christmas sales were awful. Sales tax increases are also killing AMZN - get out!

Topic.Title: Cramer said

Message.Msg: the anallysts a couple years ago had forecasts of AMZN growing earnings on top of the $2.52 peak: when the earnings growth didn't materialize on top of $2.52: the story to own changed to buy for sales increases: it's worked so far as earnings went toward 0 , AMZN stock has blown out $100 from the 166.97 lows at the end of 2011. So Crramer is not saying anything new. WS basically "jumped the shark." Just wondering why the profits disappeared as spending is one thing, but most are warehouse capitalizations so it shouldn't affect earnings so materially. yet, analysts don't touch that. Seems like WS is in business now to support squeezes higher and higher now with printed money. whether it ends up reckless like the housing bubble or tech bubble of the early 2000-8, we'll see. There's no solid foundation when profits don't support company values. And this compnay is being supported, in the end, by a leveraged up Fed giving money to the banks making the calls to support it, at higher and higher levels.

Message.Title: Why I Love Amazon
Message.Msg: Just received an 18 dollar bag of Rabbit food for my kids pets delivered to NYC from Kentucky sent OVERNIGHT (even though I only was supposed to get 2nd day air) at no additional cost. Whats not to love? They are probably ONLY losing 15 -30 dollars on this particular shipment. Dont worry...they can sell some more debt. heck, its free!

Topic.Title: Why I Love Amazon

Message.Msg: I am a fool. Book rates (published rates on a shipment like that is 85-92 dollars. Thats before you factor dimensions which is usually more than just by weight. So even if they get a 75% discount to published rates its still at a loss of about 10 bucks. And just because AMZN dont care about profits its hard to say that UPS doesnt! If its half the published rates than its a 30 dollar loss. at a minimum.
